2e8f186f55cf.title: Listenig to the audibook “Peak”(about the science of expetise and deliberate practice).

content.subtitle: Unless you keep practicing outside of your comfort zone, consistently setting and achieving challenging goals, finding your boundaries and…

virtuals.snippet: Unless you keep practicing outside of your comfort zone, consistently setting and achieving challenging goals, finding your boundaries and…
virtuals.subtitle: Unless you keep practicing outside of your comfort zone, consistently setting and achieving challenging goals, finding your boundaries and…
virtuals.emailSnippet:
The biggest insight so far is that the idea that you will get better at things just by doing them long enough is wrong.

Unless you keep practicing outside of your comfort zone, consistently setting and achieving challenging goals, finding your boundaries and breaking through them — you will just stagnate and stay on the same level of skill.

Repetition makes your actions automatic, but it isn’t enough to make you better.

paragraphs.name: f532

5b2aee37eaee.title: Listening to “The Martian” audiobook, about 50% through.

content.subtitle: Nobody has betrayed anyone, nobody is an antagonist. Nobody has orchestrated an intrigue that caused him to be left on Mars. There’s been…

virtuals.snippet: Nobody has betrayed anyone, nobody is an antagonist. Nobody has orchestrated an intrigue that caused him to be left on Mars. There’s been…
virtuals.subtitle: Nobody has betrayed anyone, nobody is an antagonist. Nobody has orchestrated an intrigue that caused him to be left on Mars. There’s been…
virtuals.emailSnippet:
The story has absolutely NO human conflict up to this point, and yet it’s fucking awesome.

Nobody has betrayed anyone, nobody is an antagonist. Nobody has orchestrated an intrigue that caused him to be left on Mars. There’s been no cowardly guy on the crew yelling “let’s leave him and get out of here or we will all die” to generate some contrived internal/external conflict. There’s no evil buerocrat in NASA standing in the way of rescuing Mark to cover his ass or for the sake of some political…

content.subtitle: I wanted to figure out how does the process of writing a Rick and Morty episode look like, and here’s the information I could assemble.

virtuals.snippet: I wanted to figure out how does the process of writing a Rick and Morty episode look like, and here’s the information I could assemble.
virtuals.subtitle: I wanted to figure out how does the process of writing a Rick and Morty episode look like, and here’s the information I could assemble.
virtuals.emailSnippet:
They have 3 boards in the writer’s room:

1. Brainstorming board

They start by brainstorming episode ideas and writing them down on the board.

These are general high concept story ideas that look like this:

2. Story Circle board

Then they work on a rough story outline. They use Dan Harmon’s story circle that represents the simplified version of Campbell’s Hero’s journey, and looks like this:

You can read more about it in the awesome series of articles about the story structure that he…

c94431162cb9.title: For those who are trying to find their passion

content.subtitle: “Ultimately, man should not ask what the meaning of his life is, but rather must recognize that it is he who is asked.”

virtuals.snippet: “Ultimately, man should not ask what the meaning of his life is, but rather must recognize that it is he who is asked.”
virtuals.subtitle: “Ultimately, man should not ask what the meaning of his life is, but rather must recognize that it is he who is asked.”
virtuals.emailSnippet:
Many people are having difficulty with “finding their passion in life”, and I think that this is the result of the misconceptions they have about how this process works. In this article I want to share some ideas that helped me to understand what I want out of life.

You don’t find your passion, you create it

People often think that there’s a magic “right” job waiting for them, and that if they find it, they’ll immediately recognize that this is what they were meant to do.

paragraphs.name: 9c78
paragraphs.text: For those who are trying to find their passion
